group_1.narration: One by one,@Magical Girls began to disappear.
The students conspiring to eradicate us Magical@Girls are delighted to witness the empty husks@of our bodies, claiming these girls have@transformed into Witches and fled from town...
As we hear about any Magical Girls who become@Witches, we promptly remove them from the group chat.
Before I knew it, the number of Magical Girls in@Yukuni City had been reduced to half, and@my heart aches as if it were being wrung...

group_1.textCenter: (So much for confiding in Kuroda about the@existence of Magical Girls...)

group_1.textRight: Our influence is falling short as the Eradication@Faction continues to grow.
Furthermore, they lack a proper understanding@of what it means to become a Witch.
Believing that turning into Witches is evidence@of Magical Girls being prompted to flee Yukuni,
they justify their genocide by labeling it as@condemnation.

group_1.textLeft: Some Magical Girls aren't even aware of the@connection to Witches...
Magical Girls are sincerely trying to battle Witches@for the sake of everyone else, and yet...
The cruelty is simply unimaginable...

group_1.textRight: Why don't you use your Magical Girl powers@to subdue them?

group_1.textLeft: We can't do that.

group_1.textRight: But everything would be resolved right away.

group_1.textLeft: I'm sure the Eradication faction is ready to record@and broadcast videos of us.
Even if we restrain them, we can't be certain@about the whereabouts of witnesses.
Trying to use force to resolve this situation would@only turn us into adversaries of the people.
Therefore, I don't think doing so would be wise.

group_1.textRight: I understand, it might not be feasible to hope for@a future of coexistence and mutual prosperity...

group_1.textLeft: That's why I believe our course of action@shouldn't be about control.

group_1.textRight: Then, what are you planning to do...?

group_1.textLeft: The grief born on the day of the avalanche,@and the rage which erupted at the Festival...
We have no choice but to heal those feelings...

group_1.textRight: I'm home.

group_1.textLeft: The landlady is stepping out for a bit of shopping.

group_1.textRight: I see.
(I've just bumped into the last person I@wanted to see...)

group_1.textLeft: Um, did I do something wrong, or...?

group_1.textRight: No, nothing.
Pardon, that was rude of me.

group_1.textLeft: Can I ask you just one question?

group_1.textRight: ...What is it?

group_1.textLeft: When did the students of Yukuni City start@spreading rumors about Magical Girls...?
Sorry, that was a weird question.

group_1.textRight: ...No, I was just surprised.
This was the first time an adult has ever spoken@to me about Magical Girls, so...

group_1.textLeft: Well, adults usually dismiss the topic as an urban@legend and don't listen to me.

group_1.textRight: That would be for the best right now.
So, please don't get involved...@I don't want to worry my mother...

group_1.textLeft: You should rely on someone for support,@or else the burden will wear you down...
I'm so sorry, Haitani...
For using my magic to summon you at my@convenience...

group_1.textRight: I should apologize too, Miura,
for asking this favor when I know you're suffering...

group_1.textLeft: Don't worry, I will accept responsibility for@saving Kuroda.
His anger and sorrow were both born@from our actions.
The blame lies with me.

group_1.textRight: No, the fault is mine.
Kuroda wanted to die because of the avalanche,@and I wouldn't let him.
Yet, I'm the one who's dead now...

group_1.textLeft: Instead of passing blame, let's share@the burden together.

group_1.textRight: Right, we're just talking in circles.
At the very least, any help I could offer you@ended alongside my life.
I'm counting on you, Miura.

group_1.textLeft: Consider it handled.

group_1.textCenter: (My magic to summon the dead is a desecration@of life. I didn't want to use it, but...)
